custom.description: Allows you to specify all configuration parameters including the type of data store, encryption properties, user data store, etc. This option has the most flexibility in setting up your installation.
custom.label: Custom Configuration

default.description: Enter only the passwords for the default administrator and the agent accessor. All other data is configured using default parameters. This option should be used primarily for evaluation or development purposes.
default.label: Default Configuration

default.description: Use this option for a quick setup. Only the passwords for the super user and agent user are required. All other configuration parameters are defaulted for you. The user and agent passwords must be different values.
default.title: Provide Default User Passwords

error.405: Method Not Allowed - only POST is honored
error.agentAdminPasswordSame: Default user and agent passwords must not match.
error.cannotConnectAD: Cannot resolve Active Directory domain name, please ensure the OpenAM host is using the Active Directory infrastructure for DNS.
error.encKeyNeed10Chars: System can be insecured as key is less than 10 characters long.
error.invalidPortNumber: Port must be greater than or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 65535
error.mismatchedCookieDomain: Cookie domain is not a part of the server URL
error.noWritePermissionToBasedir: Do not have write permission to this directory.
error.passwordDontMatch: Password and Confirm do not match
error.passwordSizeInvalid: Password must be at least 8 characters

label.enableSessionFailOver: Enable Session HA Persistence and Failover

storeType.ADWithHostAndPort: Active Directory with Host and Port

step1.description: Enter the password for the default user, amAdmin. The password must be at least 8 characters in length. If this configuration will be part of an existing deployment, the password you enter must match that of the original deployment.
step1.subtitle: Default User [amAdmin]
step1.title: Step 1: General

step2.description: Confirm the following settings to use for the server.
step2.subtitle: Server Settings
step2.title: Step 2: Server Settings

step3.description: If no other OpenAM instance already exists in the environment, then choose First Instance.  If one or more OpenAM instances already exist in the environment, choose Add to Existing Deployment.

message.noreplication: The existing OpenAM instance is not set up for replication. The following ports will be used
message.replication: The existing OpenAM instance is already set up for replication on the following ports

step3.subtitle: Configuration Store Details
step3.title: Step 3: Configuration Data Store Settings

step4.description: You can use the data store that comes with the OpenAM configuration data store, or you can use a different user data store.  A good practice for setting up production environments is to use an external user data store, one that is different than the OpenAM user data store. Please note that Policy Service and LDAP Authentication Module shall be configured to use the Directory Administrator DN and Password provided here.

message.embeddedUserStore: The OpenAM user data store is not recommended for large scale production environments or deployments with a complex topology.

step4.subtitle: User Store Details
step4.title: Step 4: User Data Store Settings

step5.description: Will this instance be deployed behind a load balancer as part of a site configuration?

message.help: This is the first instance of OpenAM, and no site configurations currently exist. To create a new site configuration, provide the following information

step5.subtitle: Site Configuration Details
step5.title: Step 5: Site Configuration

step6.description: These settings are used by OpenAM policy agents for retrieving policy agent properties.
step6.subtitle: Default Policy Agent [UrlAccessAgent]
step6.title: Step 6: Default Policy Agent User

step7.description: Take a moment to review the settings below. If any values are incorrect you may go back and modify the settings prior to configuration.
step7.noSite: This instance is not setup behind a load balancer
step7.title: Configurator Summary Details

upgrade.newVersionFound: An older version of configuration has been found
upgrade.restartContainer: Please restart your container for changes to take effect.
upgrade.subtitle: Upgrade to OpenAM ${project.version}
upgrade.title: Upgrading OpenAM
